resources.string:
Set folder to clear in 'Preferences'. Frequency should also be set there too. 

CURRENT LIMITATION: The folder you want to select must have a file inside it. Select any file to choose its parent folder as the target.
(I'll fix this soon) 

Using a 'Recursive delete' will delete a folder's contents AND ALL sub-folders too.
Uncheck this option to only delete files directly within the target folder. 

Using a 'Strict interval' means that the folder will be cleared exacly when you set it for.
This possible advantage has the disadvantage of using up some small amount of extra battery in some situations.
If this is an issue for you disable this option. 

The service/schedule is set on enabling (or unset on diasabling) the service in 'Preferences'.
Try toggling this setting if it doesn't seem to be working. 

If you ONLY want to manualy clear a folder:
- activate the service in 'Preferences'
- set the target folder
- deactivate the service
- hit the 'ClearMeOut Now' button when desired

As long as a folder is set the 'ClearMeOut Now' button will work.
